thread.title: Former Russia midfielder Sergei Filippenkov dies while playing in a friendly for ex-players
thread.title_full: Former Russia midfielder Sergei Filippenkov dies while playing in a friendly for ex-players

title: Former Russia midfielder Sergei Filippenkov dies while playing in a friendly for ex-players
text:
Former Russia midfielder Sergei Filippenkov dies while playing in a friendly for ex-players THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   9:02   9:02   
Subjects: 
Eastern Europe (362) 
MOSCOW â€” A former Russia international has died after collapsing on the field during a friendly game for ex-professional soccer players. 
Sergei Filippenkov, who made one appearance for Russia in a friendly against Brazil in 1998, was playing Thursday at Russian club Zenit Penza along with other former players. Filippenkov, who was 44, was the coach of the third-tier club. 
Zenit says Filippenkov scored a goal before becoming ill five minutes before the end. 
Filippenkov played for CSKA Moscow from 1998-2001, finishing second in the Russian league and reaching a Russian Cup final. 
After taking his first head coaching job with Zenit Penza last year, Filippenkov built the team into a promotion contender.
